response.original_title: A Flower is Not a Flower
response.overview: A girl named Bunga (19) experiences self-alienation after the death of her younger sibling, whom she raised without the presence of their parents. This loss leads her to pour all her longing into writing poems on sticky notes, which she scatters across walls and objects that hold memories of her sibling. In her grief, Bunga develops a desire to let go of her identity as a human and become a flower in its truest form.
response.title: A Flower is Not a Flower
